page.title: 02FARMING in King Lud's area.
page.content: The limestone bedrock occurs at a shallow depth below the surface resulting in a light stony soil over much of the area.This has resulted in the area being used for dairy as well as arable farming.The greater part of the farmland is however arable. Although the modern trend to remove hedges between fields in order to make much larger ones is very noticeable, the relatively high and exposed nature of the terrain has resulted in barriers of trees being left and the hedges which remain being well cared for. Most of the area is divided between two large estates, Belvoir Estate in the north and Buckminster Trust Estate in the south. The result is an area of modern farming methods and efficiency.
